caption: The burgers are delicious
Great service, food, and amazing drinks!

Ordered take out during Restaurant Week. Food was decent. Everything was respectably good. Not amazing, but at the right price you would have no problem going back. Honestly, the only issue is the pricing of the drinks to go. The strawberry basil drink was well made and tasty and has a good kick to it. The issue is thay they charge $7 for 1 serving or $30 for a container the size of a to-go soup container from most Chinese places. They say the large one is 2-4 servings. I think at the $20 or $25 mark it would make much more sense.
(Translated by Google) Very good. Excellent  (Original) Very good.  Отлично

Ordered one desert for pick up at 6 29pm and received an email receipt that my order will be ready for a drive through pick up at 6 49pm. My partner left at 6 50pm, but when he reached and called them they couldn't find it. As I am writing this review it's 7 20pm. He is still there waiting for it. I wanted to try this place but just the first experience was bad. Never ordering from here again.

Opened during the pandemic, Glover Park Grill is an example of a new way to fine dine. Located inside Glover Park Hotel, the restaurant is a bit more formal. However, to meet city regulations, they set up a large outdoor heated patio for their patrons. As you walk up, the lights strung along the patio give it more of a casual vibe. Then a hostess greets you starting service that is more formal. It's a tension that wouldn't work outside of the pandemic, but is refreshing during it for those who miss a step up from takeout and fast casual.  After dining at Glover Park Grill on a Saturday night with my house (my wife, toddler and housemate), I recommend making reservations. Here's why:  1) Safety: You reserve an outdoor table online to help with contact tracing. The moment you arrive, a masked hostess gives you hand sanitizer to use before sitting down. The patio is open-air, spacious and tables are spread apart appropriately. Every staff member is masked and keeps their distance as they take orders, bring food, etc. Menus are scanned using a smart phone and the bill is settled online to minimize touch.  2) Food: The menu is large without it being overwhelming. They have small plates, entrees that are accessible, entrees that are a bit more fancy, dessert and a generous kids menu. Each dish we ordered we enjoyed- Caesar salad, crunchy fried chicken sandwich, homemade cavatelli, pasta with tomato sauce (from the kids meal) and warm chocolate chip cookies. The standouts were the crunchy fried chicken sandwich (now on my top five best fried chicken sandwiches in the city thanks to the jalapeno honey) and chocolate chip cookies (one of the best in D.C.).  3)  Drinks: They have a diverse menu with cocktails, beer and a generous wine list. I ordered a glass of riesling for $11.  4) Atmosphere: For a pandemic outdoor space, they did a great job. The set up is simple, but still inviting, elegant and welcoming. In addition to tables, they have cushioned outdoor sofa for small groups. There are enough heaters throughout that you stay warm even though the patio has no walls. There is a roof to keep out rain.  5) Service: Staff strike a good balance of being attentive and friendly, but still professional and on point.  If you miss dining out, but want to do it safely, make a reservation at Glover Park Grill. If you have kids, there's a large playground at nearby Guy Mason Recreation Center that's a lot of fun.
Amazing place !!! Excellent service and exquisite food Definitely  I will return when they open again for eat in the restaurant 😋 👌 👏👏

Delicious deviled eggs and butternut squash soup. Diverse entrees including a pasta dish, as well as seafood and meat dishes. Very attentive, helpful, and friendly wait staff. Ambiance is dark and relaxing. Honestly some very good food. I will definitely return!
Been to a few restaurants by this chef. This one feels as stale as the others. Coffee was fine. Pastries were lacking in flavor. Nice staff but overpriced. Save your money and go elsewhere.
The food was so good and the service was absolutely amazing! Can’t wait to come back here!
The food is really really good, and the service is great. Definitely coming back friends and family.

We ordered takeout from here last night and the food was excellent. We had shrimp cocktail, the pork chop, and the burger.  We also had the bread pudding for dessert, which was to die for. Excited to have this in our neighborhood!

Went to the Glover Park Grill tonight and had a awesome time. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly. I ordered the Pan seared salmon and it was fantastic it had nice flavors. I will definitely be back!

Glad to see this opening up in the neighborhood.  I stopped by to grab some carryout and was super impressed with the food when I got home.  They have a killer burger.  All the staff was gloved up and wearing masks.  I'm looking forward to having dinner there soon!
What a great time! The hospitality was amazing.   Everyone was very diligent in following they’re covid rules. The pork chop was juicy and delicious. Can’t wait to go back
Excellent Covid protocols. Delicious food.
The place is amazing!!!! And great customer service!!!  Everything is clean, and very important , have a lot choice in your menus..but the way. Is wonderful!!!!
Great good! Fantastic service!  A wonderful addition to Glover Park/Georgetown!

The food was delicious. Our favorites were the shrimp and butternut squash soup appetizers. The pork chop and the salmon were perfect - the skin on the salmon was incredibly crispy! Desserts from Alex Levin are always a hit- I always order at least two! Staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome and safe. Will be back soon.
The drinks are way overpriced.
Great sinple Italian restaurant with complimentary parking! Nice busy bar. Friendly staff.

Just DONT EAT HERE. Great for drinks and catching a vibe, but definitely do not waste your money on the food. It's a basic italian menu executed terribly. From the apps to the dinner. Tasteless was a recurring theme. 3 out of four plates at our table were beyond sub par. 1 plate was sent back all together (the veal. All the food on the plate was so cold, rubbery. Looked and tasted like veal out of a box.) The cost was laughable for the quality, it hurt. Sooooooo many great spots in DC. But not this one, which is a rare in this city. We consider ourselves foodies and I sincerely do not like to leave reviews like this. But man, please beware. Staff was fine.

By far, the most disgusting pizza I have EVER HAD. I ordered the wild mushroom pizza and cannoli, and please tell me why my pizza showed up with grocery store button mushrooms and ZERO SEASONING OR SAUCE. The cannoli was inedible as well,  I literally threw the whole meal away. Never again.
Great happy hour, amazing meatballs, al dente pasta, friendly folks, what's not to like? I miss the summer patio bar, and hope they open a roof deck
Loved the ambiance. Rustic if your into it. The pasta was good. The bread is fresh i.e. no flavour but its fresh out the oven or so it taste. A nice place for a date.

Pretty miserable welcome and service recently. Pizza is fine but the cocktails have dipped. Miserable Server made the cocktails as well as delivering our food. Having been many times before we forgave. Came back a few days later and it was the same miserable attitude. Sorry can’t forgive two bad experiences .
Great food for your soul

Ordered a a variety of different dishes. Everything was good. Not amazing enough to make this place my favorite but not terrible. Good locations, iffy parking (none), great service. Not much to complain about.

So I actually forgot to take pictures here because everything is delicious, but Casolare is an absolute must whether you are visiting from out of town or from down the street. The oversized chicken parmigiana is outstanding! The owner/manager is always there and you can feel her passion for cuisine reflected in the food and hospitality. Valet parking is complimentary when dining in. Oh and then there’s the weekend brunch.
Visiting here.  Instead of going to Cheesecake Factory, we found this gem.  Love the service.  Great food/drinks.  Highly recommend it.
Fantastic dinner!
(Translated by Google) Excellent atention!  (Original) Muy buena atención!

It's hard to say enough positive things about this place.  The eggplant parm is stellar, the arugula salad, too.  All the pastas are great, and easily reconfigurable to be vegetarian.  My mother in law has consistently had the salmon, which is always perfect.  Add to this extremely friendly staff, and this is a terrific place.  Our two boys, 9 and 11, love it -- it's their favorite restaurant in DC; they always get pizza.  We take our family here for special occasions, and always have a great experience.  Chris, the manager, takes very good care of you!
Excellent food and staff. Chill summertime vibes.
Great food selections, well presented, super staff...well trained and courteous.
Pizza was fantastic!
Authentic Italian cuisine and a great bar

Amazing find. Very high quality. Food great service.. from one classic train CIA chef.. great job here in DC..  Super hotel. Kimpton clean. He made his own bread..daily..  And happy hour is 50% off. We had amazing stuff.  Meat balls Caesar salad Veal chop amazing.   ..... Steak. Med. Rare.... perfect.  Free valet parking. ..  Tip only. Cost..to park  . great deal. ...for dc.. .
Came to the bar for a couple of glasses wine to decompress after work and was cut off at.the bar.  Don't recommend for after work week drink.  Disappointed.

This is a very nice hotel restaurant. We had the calamari. Beet salad, pork chop, and angel hair pasta with whole clams in a light tomato sauce. All dishes were delicious. The staff was very friendly and the whole dining experience was relaxed and beyond satsfactory.
Beautiful! Great service and food.
Gr eat food and service

What a great find. Stopped in for a quick dinner and was in for a delightful dining experience. The amazing staff was very attentive and knew their menu in great detail. The Sommelier, Maeghan, chose the perfect wine for our dinner. Overall, a wonderful, delicious, dining experience. We definitely recommend Casolare for your next meal!
Average is the best and only way to describe it. Nothing wrong here but given the options in DC why settle.
Was there for a (crowded) private function with many guest chefs from the restaurant's owner's group. Fun, and some great food, but not a real test of the restaurant itself. Need to go back!
Excellent brunch !
After waiting 38 minutes for breakfast, I highly recommend these quest protein bars from the CVS down the street instead
Not so much variety.
Modern setting for some great late night wines
This is an underrated restaurant with amazing Italian food and great service. They change the menu every season and the fall menu is great for cold days.

I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone The morning manager was rude and inappropriate My order was cold and was charged for extra meat I didn’t order His response was abrasive and unprofessional Not the first time it has happined But I live in the neighborhood and wanted to support local restaurants in the area

Although I missed their happy hour my friends couldn't stop raving about it. Sounded like it would be worth a trip back. What I can personally suggest is the eggplant appetizer.  It was thinly sliced and seasoned perfectly. Did I mention how it melts in your mouth? Although I was torn between the chicken parmesan and bucatini I had the latter and it was devine. I finally get the meaning of al dente. When I tell you I did not want to stop eating, it was that good. I had plenty to take home. Try this dish and don't be afraid to ask the server for guidance. Ours did not steer me wrong.
Food was very good! Eggplant appetizer was a highlight.
Always good food a bed pleasant service. Happy is great,  try the small dishes! Giant chicken parm is fabulous!
The food use to be great.
Superb food, attentive staff, happy atmosphere and pleasing decor.
Great delicious Italian food. Bravo.
Head bartender is perfect he always makes my drinks correct the first time and the atmosphere is so laid-back and home feeling
Hidden gem of a place. Though it is a bit out of the way for premium DC fare, there was no shortage on flavor, presentation or uniqueness. My advice: share entrees and make room for dessert.

It's rare that you come to a restaurant and love everything that you try, but that is the case with Casolare. The servers know their stuff and the Restaurant Manager (Chris) even stops by every table to make sure they are enjoying themselves. What a great find!
Great food and service.  The waiter was very knowledgeable.  There only con is the price.  Would definitely go back next time I'm in town.
Wonderful atmosphere, food and service! Worked with Margo, the event planner for a graduation lunch,.She was so responsive and helpful. Love, love, love this restaurant!
Food was very good. Convenient glover park location.

We went there in a Friday night for my birthday expecting a really nice dinner. There was nothing about the dinner that was enjoyable. The staff were rude and passive and barely spoke to us. It took several attempts to get his attention more than 3 times. The food was horrible: chicken Parmesan was over cooked and tasteless, the salmon dry, the veal Marsala was dry and tasteless. All that and they were not even busy.  And the worst part, terribly overpriced. 4 of us with 5 drinks @$300. I’ve eaten at other restaurants in DC for far less.  Extremely disappointed...never again.
Ansolutely inedible food, but the aervice is fine. I post the picture of fatty portidge they call “mozzarella” on the menu. The pizzas are even worse. Soups — equally inedible.

Very relaxed, never crowded, very good food. Not sure what people are talking about the prices. Compared to Delaware, they're right on par. Hard to believe that Delaware restaurants charge more than a major metropolitan area given the cost of living is so much cheaper, but I think the prices are average for dining out at a similar restaurant in Delaware, so...we love it.
Very good food and good service
Try the housemade pasta, wow.
Restaurant with good cuisine.
Delicious food and friendly knowledgeable service. Reasonable prices for being so close to Georgetown.
Get either the shrimp or the egg plant, both are super tasty!!

The food was decent, bit not quite up to the price. However, the pizza did look very good, but we had pasta. The wait staff earnestly tried to be helpful, but needed a bit more practice. We did get everything we needed from the wait staff, they are just not smooth yet in their serving. The bar looked like a nice place to get a drink. I will likely return for pizza and a glass of wine, since that are on your neighborhood.
Wonderful and tasty meal. I had the banzino fish entree that was cooked to perfection. I didn't ask but the bread was so fresh I assume it is made on site - asked for seconds :)

I rarely give 5 star ratings to restaurants, not because I'm a "foodie" or snobby, but simply because many of them are nothing to write home about. They overcharge and underwhelm you with the quality of food and service. Not so with Casolare! I have eaten at this restaurant three times, and each time was impressed. The first was when my father came to visit and I booked him a room in the hotel (Klimpton Glover Park/Glover Park hotel).  We had breakfast together at Casolare and very much enjoyed the ambience, music, and service. My next visit was with friends and I was very impressed with the quality of the food I'd ordered (lamb with lentils, baby carrots, and brussel sprouts). Pricey though it was, our experience from start to finish was wonderful. The way it should be when you're catching up with old friends and don't want to worry about late or bland food, rude staff, etc.  Then, there's tonight. We started at the bar because the restaurant doesn't open until 5 o'clock. No problem. We had a leisurely glass of an Italian house wine and wound down. Eventually making our way to the restaurant, my friends and I were served by a very professional staff. Our waiter, Dominic, 2 or 3 or staff members who helped to clear away dishes, refill water glasses, etc, and the manager, who stopped by our table at the end of our meal.  I'm going on and on about this because 1) Our food (Margherita pizza, pizza of the day, and the grilled octopus) and dessert (Semifreddo, Cannoli, Pana Cotta) were delicious. 2) The service was impeccable. Our waiter, Dominic, was very familiar with the menu and gave excellent descriptions of each dish, as well as others on the menu. His recommendations were spot-on! 3) It's clear that everyone here really wants to do a good job and offer you an experience that is difficult to find (I think) in this area of time.  Casolare is well worth the price, given the quality of the food and staff. Oh, and whoever chooses the music has excellent taste. Give it a go!
Scallops and branzino were to die for. Can't wait to go back and trey more of the menu

The atmosphere is not interesting.  The service is very good.  The food is also good. The buratta is great.  If you order the polpette, be aware that they are meatless "meatballs". The semi-freddo is fantastic; the ice cream is less so.

This place is one of my favorites.  We just had dinner there for my mom's bday and all of the people are so incredibly nice.  I didn't get the waitresses name but she was super.  Also, all of the food is always amazing.  I would give it 10 stars if I could.  I highly recommend!!
Wonderful meal with attentive wait staff.  Loved everything we tried.
Good new restaurant in former CIA haunt.
